intro: Sphaeralcea stellata, commonly known as the starflower, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Sphaeralcea stellata is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
